title: Drawing, "Garden and Villa", 1650–1700
medium:
Pen and brown ink, green, brown wash, black chalk, ruled border in pen and brown
Support: white laid paper
provenance:
Giovanni Piancastelli
 Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A two-winged staircase, with a stone-covered court with a fountain in the center is leading to an upper terrace, where two colonnades are the conjunction to the main building. At their ends next to the staircase, small circular buildings are upon their roofs, indicating a third level where cypresses stand. Clouds indicated.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Garden and Villa", 1650–1700.
1650–1700. Pen and brown ink, green, brown wash, black chalk, ruled border in pen and brown
Support: white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3759.
